dmca.title: Subpoena in Case No.2:02 CV - 0093ST Hertz V. Does
dmca.body:
Re:     Subpoena in Case No.2:02 CV - 0093ST Hertz V. Does

Dear XXXXX:


This letter is written on behalf of Cybergate, Inc., an affiliate of
Affinity Internet, Inc. ("Affinity"). e.spire Communications, Inc.
provides legal services to Affinity pursuant to an agreement between
the two companies.

Affinity has received the attached subpoena from Hertz's attorney
requesting us to disclose information about your account. It is
e.spire's policy to allow the entity listed in our records as owner of
the account to take appropriate legal action to object to such a
disclosure.

We will disclose the information demanded in the subpoena ten days
after the date of this letter.  However, if you forward to us a valid
court order quashing or otherwise suspending the subpoena, we will
comply with the terms of such an order.

We can not advise you on what steps you should take to avoid
disclosure of this information. Please contact your attorney to
determine the appropriate method to object to the subpoena.

You may forward any information on this matter directly to me.
     


Sincerely, 

Subpena from:

Howard, Phillips & Anderson
560 E 200 South Ste 300
Salt Lake City, UT
